text: Plants have multiple different projectiles, some with different properties.
$(br2)The most common type of projectile is the Pea type: they shoot straight and hit one target.
$(br2)These projectiles are stopped by shields and go over Snorkel Zombies.
$(br2)The second most common type of projectile is the Pierce type: they shoot straight and go through Zombies.
$(br2)These projectiles go through shields and go over Snorkel Zombies. If they are a Spike projectile they can only pierce 3 zombies (Shield included). Covered Zombies reduce the pierce amount by 2.
$(br2)The third most common type of projectile is the Lobbed type: they shoot in an arc and hit the targeted Zombie regardless of obstructions.
$(br2)These projectiles ignore shields, hit Snorkel Zombies, and plants that shoot these projectiles have target priority against shield and Snorkel Zombies.
$(br2)Another type of projectile is the Splash type: any projectile can splash, and they deal damage to every Zombie around the impact area.
$(br2)The splash hits both the shield and the Zombie behind it, and hits Snorkel Zombies and Flying Zombies.
$(br2)Another type of projectile is the Elemental type: they complement a projectile by giving it special properties.
$(br2)Some examples: Ice can slow down zombies on a direct hit; Fire is useless on humid environments; Paper shields are destroyed quickly by both Fire and Water; etc.
$(br2)Similar to Splash, there's Explosion. They are not a type of projectile, but are another type of damage worth explaining.
$(br2)Explosions deal damage in an area, hitting every Zombie except for ones behind shields, hitting the shields instead.
